Description: Amulet in the round of Taweret standing frontal, suspension loop on top of head. Moulded. The amulet was built up of elements of irregular size in opaque red, black, and white glass in essentially the same technique used to form the shallow, mosaic dishes of the Eighteenth Dynasty. The legs are indicated by two minute stumps. Glossy surface.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: Sale Catalogue, Henry Salt Collection, Sotheby, London 28 June - 8 July 1835.
Bibliographic references: Tait 1991 / Five Thousand Years of Glass (fig.38, pp.36-37)
Acquisition notes: Salt sale, 1835, lot 619 (with seven other objects).
